instruction: How much water does sugarcane need?
output:
**SUGARCANE WATER REQUIREMENTS:**

**Total Water Need:** 1800-2500mm per crop cycle

**STAGE-WISE IRRIGATION:**

ðŸŒ± **Germination (0-30 days):**
â€¢ Light irrigation every 3-4 days
â€¢ 50-60mm total

ðŸŒ¿ **Tillering (30-120 days):**
â€¢ Every 7-10 days
â€¢ 400-500mm total

ðŸ“ˆ **Grand Growth (120-270 days):**
â€¢ Maximum water need
â€¢ Every 7 days
â€¢ 1000-1200mm total

ðŸŒ¾ **Maturity (270-360 days):**
â€¢ Reduce irrigation
â€¢ Every 15-20 days
â€¢ 200-300mm total
â€¢ Stop 15 days before harvest

**IRRIGATION METHODS:**
â€¢ Drip: 40% water saving
â€¢ Furrow: Traditional
â€¢ Sprinkler: For light soils

instruction: My banana plants leaves are turning yellow from bottom
output:
**DIAGNOSIS:** Likely Nitrogen Deficiency or Panama Disease

**IF NITROGEN DEFICIENCY:**
â€¢ Older leaves yellow first
â€¢ Uniform yellowing
â€¢ Stunted growth

**Treatment:**
â€¢ Urea: 200g/plant immediately
â€¢ Follow with 100g monthly
â€¢ Or DAP: 150g/plant

**IF PANAMA DISEASE (Fusarium Wilt):**
â€¢ Yellowing starts from margins
â€¢ Brown discoloration in pseudostem
â€¢ Progressive wilting

**Management:**
â€¢ No cure - remove affected plants
â€¢ Burn infected material
â€¢ Apply lime to soil
â€¢ Plant resistant varieties (Grand Naine)
â€¢ Crop rotation for 3-4 years

**DIFFERENTIATION TEST:**
â€¢ Cut pseudostem cross-section
â€¢ Brown/black = Disease
â€¢ Clear = Nutrient issue

**PREVENTION:**
â€¢ Good drainage
â€¢ Balanced nutrition
â€¢ Use disease-free suckers

instruction: My corn has holes in leaves and stem, what pest is this?
output:
**PEST:** Fall Armyworm (Spodoptera frugiperda) or Corn Borer

**DAMAGE IDENTIFICATION:**
â€¢ Pin holes in leaves
â€¢ Windowpane feeding pattern
â€¢ Bore holes in stem
â€¢ Frass (insect droppings) visible

**CONTROL MEASURES:**
â€¢ Spray: Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4g/liter
â€¢ Or: Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.3ml/liter
â€¢ Apply in evening when larvae are active

**BIOLOGICAL CONTROL:**
â€¢ Trichogramma cards: 50,000 eggs/hectare
â€¢ Bacillus thuringiensis @ 2ml/liter

**CULTURAL PRACTICES:**
â€¢ Deep plowing after harvest
â€¢ Intercrop with legumes
â€¢ Bird perches for natural predation
